skill.name: clinvar-database
skill.description: Query NCBI ClinVar for variant clinical significance. Search by gene/position, interpret pathogenicity classifications, access via E-utilities API or FTP, annotate VCFs, for genomic medicine.
skill.summary: Query NCBI ClinVar for variant clinical significance. Search by gene/position, interpret pathogenici...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill providing ClinVar query guidance. Contains example commands for NCBI API access which is legitimate bioinformatics practice. No executable code or data collection.

content.value_statement: ClinVar guidance is split across APIs, files, and terminology pages. This skill provides clear query patterns, interpretation help, and download workflows.
actual_capabilities: Provide ClinVar web and E-utilities query patterns
Explain clinical significance terms and star ratings
Describe FTP directory structure and data formats
Outline VCF annotation and filtering steps
Explain how to handle conflicting interpretations
limitations: Does not provide medical diagnosis or clinical decisions
Does not fetch live ClinVar data by itself
Requires network access to NCBI services
Large downloads require local storage and tools

use_cases.title: Gene variant review
use_cases.description: Find pathogenic variants for a gene and prioritize by review status.

use_cases.title: Interpretation support
use_cases.description: Clarify ClinVar classification terms and conflicting interpretations.

use_cases.title: Pipeline planning
use_cases.description: Plan ClinVar VCF annotation and bulk data downloads.

prompt_templates.title: Basic query
prompt_templates.prompt: Give a ClinVar web query for BRCA1 pathogenic variants and explain the fields used.

prompt_templates.title: Review status
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain ClinVar star ratings and how to prioritize high confidence variants.

prompt_templates.title: Bulk download
prompt_templates.prompt: List FTP paths for the latest ClinVar XML and GRCh38 VCF and summarize update timing.

prompt_templates.title: VCF annotation
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline steps to annotate a VCF with ClinVar and filter for pathogenic variants.

output_examples.input: Find high confidence pathogenic CFTR variants and explain how to prioritize them.
output: Use a ClinVar query that filters for CFTR and pathogenic classifications
Prefer entries with expert panel or practice guideline review status
Record the ClinVar release date used for reproducibility

best_practices: Check review status and prefer higher star ratings
Record ClinVar version and access date for reproducibility
Use the correct genome build for VCF files
anti_patterns: Treating VUS as diagnostic without expert review
Mixing GRCh37 and GRCh38 coordinates in one analysis

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The content is platform agnostic and works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the main limits of the skill?
faq.answer: It does not provide medical diagnosis and depends on external ClinVar access.

faq.question: Can it integrate with bioinformatics pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides guidance for VCF annotation and bulk data processing steps.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. It only provides guidance and does not collect or store user data.

faq.question: What should I do if an API request fails?
faq.answer: Check query syntax, respect rate limits, and retry with exponential backoff.

faq.question: How does this compare to the ClinVar website?
faq.answer: It adds structured query guidance, interpretation help, and bulk download workflows.
